articles.title: December Is Best For Stocks But Prepare For January 6
articles.content: December is the best month for stocks, but expect potential profit-taking in the first week of January. Read why investors should focus on stock picking.

articles.title: What’s new on Max, Netflix and other streamers in December — and which subscriptions to keep and which to pause
articles.content: ‘Squid Game’ is back, plus ‘Star Wars: Skeleton Crew’ and a ‘Dexter’ prequel highlight a slow month. Plus, here are the best series of the year, and recommendations for best escapist shows.

articles.title: Crucial jobs report kicks off December trading: What to know this week
articles.content: Key updates on the health of the US labor market are set to greet investors in the first week of December trading.

articles.title: Is Arm Holdings Stock a Buy Now?
articles.content: The semiconductor space has had its fair share of big winners this year, with Arm Holdings (NASDAQ: ARM) among them.  With this having been a stellar year for the company, the question now turns to whether the stock is a buy heading into 2025.  Let's see if investors should consider Arm after the stock's run-up this year.

articles.title: 4 Reasons to Buy Apple Stock Like There's No Tomorrow
articles.content: There's a reason the iPhone maker's stock is climbing even when its business isn't actually growing.

articles.title: What Might The Fed Do After The November Jobs Report
articles.content: November job report will influence the Fed's rate cut decision, while trade war concerns impact job growth and inflation across various sectors. Read more here.

articles.title: A Top Mission for Europe’s Chief Is to Cool Trump’s Ire Toward the EU
articles.content: Donald Trump is threatening Europe over trade and war. What comes next will depend partly on Ursula von der Leyen.

articles.title: The iPhone’s ‘Lockdown Mode’: What It Is and Who Should Consider Using It
articles.content: The feature is largely for high-profile targets. But others might think it’s worth using, despite the inconvenience.

articles.title: Irish Vote Close as Exit Poll Puts PM Harris, Sinn Fein Level
